intro: Reissantia astericantha, commonly known as the star-leaved aster, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive star-like pattern on the underside. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in the spring and are followed by fluffy, white seed heads that aid in wind pollination. Reissantia astericantha is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodlands and meadows.
